intro: Semeiostachys panormitana, commonly known as the Panormitan sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Native to specific regions in the Mediterranean, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, wind-pollinated flowers, which are typically green or brown in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
